basics.name: Jack Yang
basics.label: Reimagining Reality with XR + AI
basics.summary: I'm Jack, an XR engineer at Microsoft focused on Microsoft Mesh and Teams avatars. Since 2015 I've been shipping XR + AI products that make remote collaboration feel natural and human.

highlights: Shipped performant social experiences that behave consistently across headsets, desktops, and mobile devices.
Led cross-functional pushes to improve performance, accessibility, and localization for avatar customization tools.
Built data-driven content pipelines and workflows that keep web, VR, and standalone clients in sync.
Developed an AR/VR training platform with gesture recognition, hand tracking, and contextual guidance.
Added multiplayer networking, automated 3D model ingestion, and richer interaction mechanics.
Partnered with leadership to secure a $750K U.S. Air Force contract and acceptance into TechStars.
Created chromatic adjustment algorithms to simulate color blindness on hyperspectral imagery and ported them into a color-calibrated Oculus Rift demo.
Built an AI model that mimics human color vision behavior, reaching 90% chromatic adjustment accuracy.
Built a low-latency VR control loop that maps hand gestures to remote robot arms.
Designed a Unity UI that replays robot arm motion from datasets spanning 15+ lab experiments.

courses: Double majored in Computer Science and Communication Arts.
Served as a teaching assistant for CS 559 (Computer Graphics).
Studied game design at the CMU Entertainment Technology Center.
Led development and release of Kitchen Kraving, a VR game for Oculus Rift DK2.
